title: How to Make a Homemade Suzy Q

steps.headline: Sift and blend the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt.
Add the butter and granulated sugar into the mixture until the mixture is light and fluffy.
Blend into the mixture the eggs, vanilla extract, water and milk.
Beat the mixture until it combines.
Pour the batter into a mini-loaf or cupcake pan until the pan is 1/2 to 3/4 full from the bottom.
Let these cakes cool for a substantial amount of time on a wire rack.
Cut these cakes in half lengthwise with a serrated knife.
steps.description: You can prepare the Suzy Q filling now.

steps.headline: Combine all ingredients needed to prepare the Suzy Q filling.
steps.description: This includes the flour, milk, vanilla extract, butter, shortening, and granulated sugar.

steps.headline: Stop blending the frosting ingredients together until they appear smooth and creamy.
steps.description: But don't let them discolor or let them form a skin.

steps.headline: Cover one side of the cakes with a good dousing of the frosting to completely cover it.
Place another "cake" on top of the frosting-covered side of the initial cake.
Finish preparing and serve your finished Suzy Q candy bar.

text: Preheat an oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Sift and blend the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt.  Add the butter and granulated sugar into the mixture until the mixture is light and fluffy.  Blend into the mixture the eggs, vanilla extract, water and milk.  Beat the mixture until it combines.  Pour the batter into a mini-loaf or cupcake pan until the pan is 1/2 to 3/4 full from the bottom.  Bake these cakes for 35-40 minutes.  Let these cakes cool for a substantial amount of time on a wire rack.  Cut these cakes in half lengthwise with a serrated knife. You can prepare the Suzy Q filling now. Combine all ingredients needed to prepare the Suzy Q filling. This includes the flour, milk, vanilla extract, butter, shortening, and granulated sugar. Blend these ingredients together.  Stop blending the frosting ingredients together until they appear smooth and creamy. But don't let them discolor or let them form a skin. Cover one side of the cakes with a good dousing of the frosting to completely cover it.  Place another "cake" on top of the frosting-covered side of the initial cake.  Finish preparing and serve your finished Suzy Q candy bar.
